verses.kjv: Now these are the priests and the Levites that went up with Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, and Jeshua: Seraiah, Jeremiah, Ezra,
verses.ct: These are the priests and Levites who returned with Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel, and Jeshua: Seraiah, Jeremiah, Ezra,

verses.kjv: Amariah, Malluch, Hattush,
verses.ct: Amariah, Malluch, Hattush,

verses.kjv: Shechaniah, Rehum, Meremoth,
verses.ct: Shechaniah, Rehum, Meremoth,

verses.kjv: Iddo, Ginnetho, Abijah,
verses.ct: Iddo, Ginnetho, Abijah,

verses.kjv: Miamin, Maadiah, Bilgah,
verses.ct: Miamin, Maadiah, Bilgah,

verses.kjv: Shemaiah, and Joiarib, Jedaiah,
verses.ct: Shemaiah, Joiarib, Jedaiah,

verses.kjv: Sallu, Amok, Hilkiah, Jedaiah. These were the chief of the priests and of their brethren in the days of Jeshua.
verses.ct: Sallu, Amok, Hilkiah, and Jedaiah. These were the leading priests and their brothers during the time of Jeshua.

verses.kjv: Moreover the Levites: Jeshua, Binnui, Kadmiel, Sherebiah, Judah, and Mattaniah, which was over the thanksgiving, he and his brethren.
verses.ct: The Levites included: Jeshua, Binnui, Kadmiel, Sherebiah, Judah, and Mattaniah, who was in charge of the songs of thanksgiving, along with his brothers.

verses.kjv: Also Bakbukiah and Unni, their brethren, were over against them in the watches.
verses.ct: Bakbukiah and Unni, their brothers, served opposite them during the worship duties.

verses.kjv: And Jeshua begat Joiakim, Joiakim also begat Eliashib, and Eliashib begat Joiada,
verses.ct: Jeshua became the father of Joiakim, Joiakim became the father of Eliashib, and Eliashib became the father of Joiada.

verses.kjv: And Joiada begat Jonathan, and Jonathan begat Jaddua.
verses.ct: Joiada became the father of Jonathan, and Jonathan became the father of Jaddua.

verses.kjv: And in the days of Joiakim were priests, the chief of the fathers: of Seraiah, Meraiah; of Jeremiah, Hananiah;
verses.ct: During the time of Joiakim, the following priests served as heads of their families: from Seraiah's family, Meraiah; from Jeremiah's family, Hananiah;

verses.kjv: Of Ezra, Meshullam; of Amariah, Jehohanan;
verses.ct: from Ezra's family, Meshullam; from Amariah's family, Jehohanan;

verses.kjv: Of Melicu, Jonathan; of Shebaniah, Joseph;
verses.ct: from Melicu's family, Jonathan; from Shebaniah's family, Joseph;

verses.kjv: Of Harim, Adna; of Meraioth, Helkai;
verses.ct: from Harim's family, Adna; from Meraioth's family, Helkai;

verses.kjv: Of Iddo, Zechariah; of Ginnethon, Meshullam;
verses.ct: from Iddo's family, Zechariah; from Ginnethon's family, Meshullam;

verses.kjv: Of Abijah, Zichri; of Miniamin, of Moadiah, Piltai;
verses.ct: from Abijah's family, Zichri; from Miniamin's and Moadiah's families, Piltai;

verses.kjv: Of Bilgah, Shammua; of Shemaiah, Jehonathan;
verses.ct: from Bilgah's family, Shammua; from Shemaiah's family, Jehonathan;

verses.kjv: And of Joiarib, Mattenai; of Jedaiah, Uzzi;
verses.ct: from Joiarib's family, Mattenai; from Jedaiah's family, Uzzi;

verses.kjv: Of Sallai, Kallai; of Amok, Eber;
verses.ct: from Sallai's family, Kallai; from Amok's family, Eber;

verses.kjv: Of Hilkiah, Hashabiah; of Jedaiah, Nethaneel.
verses.ct: from Hilkiah's family, Hashabiah; from Jedaiah's family, Nethaneel.

verses.kjv: The Levites in the days of Eliashib, Joiada, and Johanan, and Jaddua, were recorded chief of the fathers: also the priests, to the reign of Darius the Persian.
verses.ct: The Levites during the time of Eliashib, Joiada, Johanan, and Jaddua were registered as heads of families, as were the priests, up through the reign of Darius the Persian.

verses.kjv: The sons of Levi, the chief of the fathers, were written in the book of the chronicles, even until the days of Johanan the son of Eliashib.
verses.ct: The descendants of Levi who served as family heads were recorded in the official records up through the time of Johanan son of Eliashib.

verses.kjv: And the chief of the Levites: Hashabiah, Sherebiah, and Jeshua the son of Kadmiel, with their brethren over against them, to praise and to give thanks, according to the commandment of David the man of God, ward over against ward.
verses.ct: The leading Levites were Hashabiah, Sherebiah, and Jeshua son of Kadmiel, along with their brothers stationed opposite them, to offer praise and thanksgiving as David, the man of God, had commanded — group responding to group.

verses.kjv: Mattaniah, and Bakbukiah, Obadiah, Meshullam, Talmon, Akkub, were porters keeping the ward at the thresholds of the gates.
verses.ct: Mattaniah, Bakbukiah, Obadiah, Meshullam, Talmon, and Akkub were gatekeepers who stood guard at the storerooms near the gates.

verses.kjv: These were in the days of Joiakim the son of Jeshua, the son of Jozadak, and in the days of Nehemiah the governor, and of Ezra the priest, the scribe.
verses.ct: These men served during the time of Joiakim son of Jeshua, son of Jozadak, and during the time of Nehemiah the governor and Ezra the priest and scribe.

verses.kjv: And at the dedication of the wall of Jerusalem they sought the Levites out of all their places, to bring them to Jerusalem, to keep the dedication with gladness, both with thanksgivings, and with singing, with cymbals, psalteries, and with harps.
verses.ct: For the dedication of Jerusalem's wall, they searched for the Levites wherever they lived and brought them to Jerusalem to celebrate the dedication with joy, with thanksgiving songs, and with music from cymbals, harps, and lyres.

verses.kjv: And the sons of the singers gathered themselves together, both out of the plain country round about Jerusalem, and from the villages of Netophathi;
verses.ct: The musicians gathered from the region surrounding Jerusalem and from the villages of the Netophathites,

verses.kjv: Also from the house of Gilgal, and out of the fields of Geba and Azmaveth: for the singers had builded them villages round about Jerusalem.
verses.ct: as well as from Beth-gilgal and the countryside around Geba and Azmaveth, since the musicians had built settlements for themselves around Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And the priests and the Levites purified themselves, and purified the people, and the gates, and the wall.
verses.ct: The priests and Levites purified themselves, and then they purified the people, the gates, and the wall.

verses.kjv: Then I brought up the princes of Judah upon the wall, and appointed two great companies of them that gave thanks, whereof one went on the right hand upon the wall toward the dung gate:
verses.ct: I brought the leaders of Judah up on top of the wall and organized 2 large choirs to give thanks. One group proceeded to the right along the wall toward the Dung Gate.

verses.kjv: And after them went Hoshaiah, and half of the princes of Judah,
verses.ct: Following behind them went Hoshaiah and half of Judah's leaders,

verses.kjv: And Azariah, Ezra, and Meshullam,
verses.ct: along with Azariah, Ezra, Meshullam,

verses.kjv: Judah, and Benjamin, and Shemaiah, and Jeremiah,
verses.ct: Judah, Benjamin, Shemaiah, and Jeremiah,

verses.kjv: And certain of the priests’ sons with trumpets; namely, Zechariah the son of Jonathan, the son of Shemaiah, the son of Mattaniah, the son of Michaiah, the son of Zaccur, the son of Asaph:
verses.ct: as well as some of the priests' descendants carrying trumpets — specifically Zechariah son of Jonathan, son of Shemaiah, son of Mattaniah, son of Michaiah, son of Zaccur, son of Asaph —

verses.kjv: And his brethren, Shemaiah, and Azarael, Milalai, Gilalai, Maai, Nethaneel, and Judah, Hanani, with the musical instruments of David the man of God, and Ezra the scribe before them.
verses.ct: and his brothers Shemaiah, Azarael, Milalai, Gilalai, Maai, Nethaneel, Judah, and Hanani, carrying the musical instruments prescribed by David, the man of God. Ezra the scribe led the procession.

verses.kjv: And at the fountain gate, which was over against them, they went up by the stairs of the city of David, at the going up of the wall, above the house of David, even unto the water gate eastward.
verses.ct: At the Fountain Gate, they climbed the steps of the City of David where the wall rises, passing above David's palace, and continued on to the Water Gate on the east side.

verses.kjv: And the other company of them that gave thanks went over against them, and I after them, and the half of the people upon the wall, from beyond the tower of the furnaces even unto the broad wall;
verses.ct: The second thanksgiving choir went in the opposite direction. I followed them, along with half of the people, walking along the top of the wall past the Tower of the Ovens all the way to the Broad Wall,

verses.kjv: And from above the gate of Ephraim, and above the old gate, and above the fish gate, and the tower of Hananeel, and the tower of Meah, even unto the sheep gate: and they stood still in the prison gate.
verses.ct: then past the Gate of Ephraim, over the Old Gate, past the Fish Gate, the Tower of Hananeel, and the Tower of Meah, continuing to the Sheep Gate. They came to a stop at the Guard Gate.

verses.kjv: So stood the two companies of them that gave thanks in the house of God, and I, and the half of the rulers with me:
verses.ct: Both thanksgiving choirs then took their positions in the house of God, along with me and half of the officials who were with me.

verses.kjv: And the priests; Eliakim, Maaseiah, Miniamin, Michaiah, Elioenai, Zechariah, and Hananiah, with trumpets;
verses.ct: The priests Eliakim, Maaseiah, Miniamin, Michaiah, Elioenai, Zechariah, and Hananiah were there with their trumpets,

verses.kjv: And Maaseiah, and Shemaiah, and Eleazar, and Uzzi, and Jehohanan, and Malchijah, and Elam, and Ezer. And the singers sang loud, with Jezrahiah their overseer.
verses.ct: along with Maaseiah, Shemaiah, Eleazar, Uzzi, Jehohanan, Malchijah, Elam, and Ezer. The singers performed at full volume under the direction of Jezrahiah, their leader.

verses.kjv: Also that day they offered great sacrifices, and rejoiced: for God had made them rejoice with great joy: the wives also and the children rejoiced: so that the joy of Jerusalem was heard even afar off.
verses.ct: On that day they offered enormous sacrifices and celebrated, because God had filled them with tremendous joy. The women and children celebrated too, and the sound of Jerusalem's rejoicing could be heard from far away.

verses.kjv: And at that time were some appointed over the chambers for the treasures, for the offerings, for the firstfruits, and for the tithes, to gather into them out of the fields of the cities the portions of the law for the priests and Levites: for Judah rejoiced for the priests and for the Levites that waited.
verses.ct: At that time, men were appointed to oversee the storerooms for the contributions, the first portions of the harvest, and the tithes. They were responsible for collecting from the surrounding fields the shares required by the law for the priests and Levites, because the people of Judah were grateful for the priests and Levites who served.

verses.kjv: And both the singers and the porters kept the ward of their God, and the ward of the purification, according to the commandment of David, and of Solomon his son.
verses.ct: The singers and gatekeepers carried out their duties for their God and maintained the purification requirements, just as David and his son Solomon had commanded.

verses.kjv: For in the days of David and Asaph of old there were chief of the singers, and songs of praise and thanksgiving unto God.
verses.ct: Long ago, in the days of David and Asaph, there had been directors of the musicians and songs of praise and thanksgiving to God.

verses.kjv: And all Israel in the days of Zerubbabel, and in the days of Nehemiah, gave the portions of the singers and the porters, every day his portion: and they sanctified holy things unto the Levites; and the Levites sanctified them unto the children of Aaron.
verses.ct: During the time of Zerubbabel and during the time of Nehemiah, all of Israel contributed the daily portions for the singers and gatekeepers. They set aside what was holy for the Levites, and the Levites in turn set aside what was holy for the descendants of Aaron.
